citation: Local Government (Break O'Day and Glamorgan-Spring Bay Councils Elections) Order 2009 (Tas)
text:
Local Government (Break O'Day and Glamorgan-Spring Bay Councils Elections) Order 2009

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following order under section 268A(1A) of the Local Government Act 1993 .

2 November 2009

PETER G. UNDERWOOD

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

J. G. COX

Minister for Local Government

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Local Government (Break O'Day and Glamorgan-Spring Bay Councils Elections) Order 2009 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
    The Acts Interpretation Act 1931 applies to the interpretation of this order as if it were by-laws.

4. Closing day for elections
    The day fixed as the closing day for the elections in respect of the Break O'Day Council and the Glamorgan-Spring Bay Council (which elections were postponed by the Local Government (Elections) Order 2009 ) is 22 December 2009.

5. Legislation revoked
    The legislation specified in Schedule 1 is revoked.

SCHEDULE 1 - Legislation revoked

Clause 5

Local Government (Elections) Order 2009 (No. 81 of 2009)
                                                        


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 4 November 2009

This order is administered in the Department of Premier and Cabinet.
